name: Vagharela Bhath
author: SUSMITA
summary: I am always on the lookout for quick and easy lunch recipes. I really like the ones that use leftover rice as that is something we always have at our house. I learned this recipe from a Gujarati friend. You can omit the onions if you want.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons lime juice, or to taste
directions: Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat

Fry the mustard seeds in the oil until they begin to splutter, 2 to 3 minutes; add the curry leaves and asafoetida powder and cook together for 1 minute before adding the onion, potato, green chile peppers, turmeric, sugar, and salt
Cook and stir the mixture until the potatoes are tender, about 10 minutes
Crumble the rice into the skillet, breaking the grains apart as best you can
Stir the rice into the mixture, continuing to separate the grains your spoon as you stir; cook until the rice is thoroughly heated, 2 to 3 minutes
Add the lime juice and cilantro to serve
